title: Voice stories.
body:
Finally you done it Riot! 
Thank you for listening to me all those months ago when I requested this. :D 
I really didn't think you would listen to me and do this <3 Now my disabled friend can also know the stories of Bilgewater without needing to have read their lore! :D 
Thanks a lot again! I can't wait to see more of these. 

Also love Bridgewater map!

replies.body:
You know, I so badly wanted to say "OMG HOW DID YOU KNOW?"

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

OMG HOW DID YOU KNOW? 

sorry for 11 month late to respond.
I hope they do these from every lore event .
Please give Riot that feedback directly :-)
How? Aren't you Riot? To whom should we give feedback to?

There's only so many times I can keep insisting that players tell me they want more content. I think the Publishing teams and Product Owners just don't believe me anymore...

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
That doesn't answer the question. If not you, what's the proper avenue to give that feedback? Support ticket? That seems... a tad over-kill.
Things like Twitter though that raises the question as to whom we send it to?
Not me you should direct that message to. Reply to Scathlocke, so he gets notified and everything.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=WRvY05oE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-06-01T16:02:57.605+0000)
>
> Please give Riot that feedback directly :-)

Trough the support page ¿

Not to sell myself out, but if you're looking for league stories which are read with music and sound (and visual) effects, [check out my channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwu032dLmX56Ky190srhoIQ/videos) :)

I just have to say, that even if the Voice Stories are good, i find that they lose a lot of their "charm" in written form... I mean, if you read the stories without the sound... it sounds like the man is alone, speaking with no one... is just... weird.

But i liked the stories anyways.
